abstract: United States military officials report that criminal investigation of accusations that Army Special Forces team murdered at least 17 civilians in Afghanistan in 2012 and 2013 has been reopened.
lead_paragraph: The investigation focuses on at least 17 murders in 2012 and 2013 that Afghan officials blamed on an Army Special Forces team based in Wardak Province.

headline.main: U.S. Army Reopens Criminal Inquiry Into Afghan Civilians’ Deaths
headline.print_headline: U.S. Reopens Inquiry Into 2012-13 Murders of 17 Afghan Civilians

snippet: The investigation focuses on at least 17 murders in 2012 and 2013 that Afghan officials blamed on an Army Special Forces team based in Wardak Province.
